body.p:
Maysville Kentucky
Oct 23d 1865
Col. J. W Gault
Louisville

Dear Sir Accept my thanks for kindness to Mrs Elizabeth Stull She is a clever woman and her husband is unworthy of her -- She and her children will suffer this winter if they cannot get the pay and bounty due her husband -- She tells me her husband will die I do not know him never saw him but am satisfied from what she says that he ought to be pardoned for her sake if for nothing else -- If you will write to Gov Bramlette and tell him the Story of this man and woman -- that the jury are signing the petition for his pardon and that Genl Palmer has done so and what you and I think about it he can and he will telegraph the President to Pardon him and the President will do it at once Say to the Governor that what I do -- I do as a Union man not as a Lawyer, not for a fee that I could not be induced to take a cent of this womans money He can obtain the pardon & will
